reviews.text: Well the station is located in a good area and not far from the town and shops. The ticket office doesn't have step free access down to the platforms and the platform area is a bit run down to be honest. There's a car park located next to the platform towards Longbridge.

We are fortunate to have a train station in King’s Norton. There are regular services into the city centre, and you can get into town in only 15 minutes. It’s really odd that one of the other reviewers here claims that there is no step-free access to the platforms. They can’t have noticed that is a lengthy step-free pathway to platform 1 from the station, and you can get to platform 4 along the step-free service road that leads to the platform and car park.

ticket office hardly open, when u need a travel card have to go to next station.the station is shabby.the platforms need a complete rebuild.it was far better in the 1960,s.to 80,s.even had platform's 3,4 open back then.
Basic station with a frequent service on the Cross City line. Ticket office open only a few hours a day. Could do with some refurbishment overall.
